channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Prison inmate who tested positive for Covid-19 had been jailed for overstaying
item.description:
June 20, 2020 9:19 PM

SINGAPORE - The 21-year-old prison inmate who was reported to have tested positive for coronavirus on Friday had been sentenced on June 12 for overstaying.

item.title: More people in Singapore diagnosed with young onset dementia: National Neuroscience Institute
item.description:
June 20, 2020 8:30 PM

SINGAPORE - More people here are being diagnosed with young onset dementia and the number is set to grow amid increasing awareness among the public as well as the medical community, according to the National Neuroscience Institute (NNI).

item.title: Before her dementia diagnosis at the early age of 51, she was told she had a rare fatal disease
item.description:
June 20, 2020 8:30 PM

SINGAPORE - It was french toast, a long-time family breakfast favourite, that sparked the realisation that something was not right. Ms Emily Ong, who likes cooking for her husband and two daughters, reached out for a loaf of bread to make the toast but forgot how.

item.title: Coronavirus: Charity resumes grocery distribution to needy families
item.description:
June 20, 2020 8:08 PM

SINGAPORE - Mr Zamry Abdul Karim, who is blind and lives alone in a two-room flat in Sembawang, can get around on his own and buy food or items from shops or stalls he is familiar with.

item.title: Issues with digitalisation and jobs are main concerns of people at Reach dialogue
item.description:
June 20, 2020 8:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Singapore's push to go digital is not going to be a walk in the park, some people said at a virtual dialogue with three government leaders on Friday (June 19).

item.title: Two men used drone to transport drugs from Johor Baru to Kranji Reservoir Park
item.description:
June 20, 2020 6:34 PM

SINGAPORE - Four Singaporeans were arrested for suspected drug activities in which a drone was used to transport a bag of drugs from Johor Baru to Kranji. Â

item.title: This week's top reads from The Straits Times
item.description:
June 20, 2020 6:15 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the week's top reads.

item.title: Coronavirus: Holland Village restaurant ordered to close after crowds gather at eatery
item.description:
June 20, 2020 6:12 PM

SINGAPORE - A restaurant in Holland Village was ordered to close by the authorities after crowds gathered at the eatery on Friday evening (June 19), the first day of phase two of Singapore's reopening.

item.title: 218 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 2 in the community
item.description:
June 20, 2020 3:10 PM

The two community cases are both work pass holders.

item.title: Made For Families brand mark aims to assure families of government and community support
item.description:
June 20, 2020 12:00 PM

SINGAPORE - The National Population and Talent Division (NPTD) has unveiled a new brand mark - Made for Families - for organisations to identify themselves as promoting the value of the family in Singapore's society.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 20
item.description:
June 20, 2020 8:30 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, June 20.

item.title: After pandemic, Singapore must shift towards a green economy
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

In April, for the first time in history, oil prices fell below zero.

item.title: Average number of new community Covid-19 cases daily falls for 5th straight day
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The average number of new daily Covid-19 patients in the community has continued to come down, from nine cases two weeks ago to four in the past week as of yesterday, the fifth straight day that the figure has fallen.

item.title: Inter-faith hub names its first woman leader
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The Harmony Centre will get its first woman leader next month, when Ustazah Liyana Rosli Asmara takes over the inter-faith hub at An-Nahdhah Mosque in Bishan.

item.title: Father-son duo look out for patients, each other
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Syaiful Sa'adon is a radiographer. Mr Sa'adon Tunot is a patient relations associate, managing visitor flow at Khoo Teck Puat Hospital's emergency department.

item.title: Buzz is back as malls reopen, dining in resumes
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

As shops and malls opened for business and dining in resumed, more people left their homes yesterday when Singapore moved into the second phase of the reopening of the economy.

item.title: Phase two will be test of public hygiene habits: Masagos
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of personal hygiene, but the test of whether it has changed people's habits will be in phase two of Singapore's reopening, when people are allowed to dine in at food and beverage outlets again.

item.title: Son inspires dad to start mask donation drive
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Close to 15,000 surgical masks will be donated by dentists to various nursing homes in Singapore by the end of the month.

item.title: Museums to reopen next Friday with limit on visitors
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Museums will reopen next Fri-day and heritage centres on July 3, the National Heritage Board (NHB) said in an advisory released yesterday.

item.title: Local production, diversification are ways to safeguard food security
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Growing more food locally and increasing the number of import sources are ways that Singapore safeguards its food security in the face of shocks like Covid-19.

item.title: Adjustments to be made to meet change in demand for gas
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Utilities firm SP Group will be adjusting the gas transmission and distribution network over the next few weeks in the light of changing gas demands as Singapore enters phase two of its reopening.

item.title: Buzz at condo sales galleries but limit on number of visitors
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Sales galleries for private condominium projects reopened for the first time in over two months yesterday, but there were no large crowds as developers have adopted by-appointment-only visits.

item.title: Practical approach needed in tackling climate change
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Tackling climate change requires a practical approach, and Singapore must recognise that part of the petrochemical sector will remain even as the country continues to push the boundaries on cutting emissions, said Minister for the Environment and Water Resources Masagos Zulkifli.

item.title: Contamination by Covid-19 patients peaks during first week of illness: Study
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A new study by the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) has found that the ability of Covid-19 patients to contaminate their environment with the coronavirus peaks during the first week of their illness, but falls significantly afterwards.

item.title: Distributors struggle with egg glut prompted by earlier panic buying
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Egg distributors here are scrambling to figure out ways to deal with an oversupply prompted by panic buying in March and early April.

item.title: Queues manageable as shoppers return, say malls and retailers
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Malls and retailers breathed a sigh of relief yesterday as shoppers streamed in for most of the day, heralding the start of phase two of Singapore's reopening.

item.title: Celebrating dads: Doc who stays away from family to volunteer at dorms; father-son duos who help in Covid-19 fight
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

ST celebrates the efforts of healthcare workers who contributed to the nationâs fight against Covid-19.

item.title: askST: Must visitors to homes wear masks? Are staycations allowed in phase 2?
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Household visitors are strongly encouraged to observe safe management principles, including wearing a mask.

item.title: DBS creating eco-friendly urban farm for employees
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

DBS Bank plans to transform a patch of its outdoor space at one of its buildings into a community farm, and give its employees a chance to try urban farming, it said this week.

item.title: Nursing home residents and kin relieved as visits resume
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Retired lawyer Michael Shah, 63, has been counting the days since he last saw his 65-year-old wife, who has Alzheimer's disease and has been in Orange Valley Nursing Home in Clementi since 2007.

item.title: Congregational, worship services can start with up to 50 people
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

More religious activities were allowed to gradually resume at places of worship from yesterday, with the necessary precautions in place to reduce physical interactions.

item.title: Safra, HomeTeamNS members to get free 3-month membership extension
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Safra and HomeTeamNS members will receive a three-month extension of their membership for free, due to the closure of most clubhouse facilities during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Singapore Pools to resume draws, reopen outlets from Monday
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Pools will resume lottery draws and outlet operations from Monday, the company said in a statement yesterday.

item.title: PAP MP questions WP chief's support for Alfian Sa'at
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

People's Action Party (PAP) MP Tan Wu Meng has criticised Workers' Party chief Pritam Singh for supporting Singapore poet and playwright Alfian Sa'at, saying Mr Alfian is not a "loving critic" of Singapore.

item.title: askST@NLB podcast looks at new ways of working
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

With most workplaces shut to stem the spread of Covid-19 during the circuit breaker period, the importance of flexible work arrangements and the use of technology to facilitate remote working came under the spotlight like never before.

item.title: Dining in safety
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Diners at Thomson Plaza's Koufu foodcourt had to eat with table shields between them, as the reopening of Singapore's economy was expanded yesterday to allow people to dine in.

item.title: More support for NTUC members aged 40 and above to upgrade skills
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Union members who are aged 40 and over will soon receive more support to upgrade their current skills and learn new ones.

item.title: Doc stayed away from family to volunteer at dorms
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

For two months, he lived apart from his family to avoid infecting them so that he could volunteer at the migrant worker dormitories during the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Crowds back at eateries, shops as more coronavirus curbs lifted
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Playgrounds long silent rang with laughter yesterday, people had coffee with old friends they had not seen in a while and queues materialised, as Singaporeans waited patiently to get into malls, shops and restaurants after more than two months of doing without.

item.title: Several injured in Sembawang crash
No ordinary Singapore chicken
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

As a ground-dwelling bird that looks like a domestic chicken, Singapore's endangered red junglefowl is often confused for being poultry.

item.title: S'pore's phase 2 reopening: Homecoming of sorts as a city reunites with its residents
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

It's been a sweet day, sweeping away the dust of isolation, and yet all joy must be tempered.

item.title: MOM warns of phishing scam using fake e-mail address
item.description:
June 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A potential phishing campaign designed to steal personal data as well as the financial information of individuals and companies is being planned by hackers using a fake Ministry of Manpower (MOM) e-mail address, the ministry warned yesterday.

item.title: askST: As retail businesses reopen for Phase 2, shops must stay safe
item.description:
June 20, 2020 4:00 AM

This is the third of an eight-part series brought to you by the Ministry of Trade and Industry, Manpower Ministry and Enterprise Singapore. Learn the Dos and Don'ts of retail businesses operating from June 19.

item.title: Man who threw bicycle at NEA officers after getting caught for littering charged
item.description:
June 20, 2020 12:32 AM

SINGAPORE - A Singaporean man accused of punching and kicking a National Environmental Agency (NEA) officer after being stopped for littering was charged in court on Saturday (June 20).
